grading_system.description: Cannot verify specific grading methodology. County issues written inspection reports and Permits to Operate for facilities meeting minimum state requirements but specific grading system not documented.

inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Complaint basis or routine schedule - specific triggers not documented
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Written inspection reports can be viewed upon request at the food facility or Environmental Health Department

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - State retail food laws
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspections conducted by Modoc County Environmental Health for compliance with State retail food laws
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: California Health and Safety Code, California Code of Regulations Titles 17 and 22, and local ordinances

confidence_notes: Limited information available on official website. Cannot verify specific grading system, inspection frequencies, or fire safety authority. No specific documentation found regarding letter grades, numerical scoring, or pass/fail systems.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Modoc County Environmental Health required to verify: 1) Specific grading/scoring system used 2) Inspection frequency schedule 3) Fire department contact and commercial kitchen fire safety requirements 4) Specific local ordinances beyond state code 5) Risk-based inspection categories

warnings: ⚠️  [integrity] facility_safety_authority.hood_system_inspection_required: Hood system requirement unknown — critical for commercial kitchen compliance
